name: Hamburger Stew with Cabbage
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: I grew up in Kansas City, where my parent's would go to Shoney's once a week. They had an all-you-can-eat soup and salad bar and it was the highlight of my week. Even as a kid, I've always loved soup. Then we moved out of state. Even though it has been nearly 40 years since I last had it, I never forgot about their beef and cabbage soup. I decided to recreate it based off my memory and here is what I came up with. Enjoy!
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans dark red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Crumble ground beef in a large soup pot and cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes
Add bell pepper, onion, and celery
Add kidney beans, tomatoes, cabbage, beef broth, water, beef bouillon, garlic, and Worcestershire sauce; stir to combine
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes
Ladle into bowls and salt to taste
